intro: Dicoryphe platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leaf daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Its leaves are broad and flat, which gives it its common name. Dicoryphe platyphylla is often found in open habitats and is relatively drought-tolerant.
